p: Results of pulmonary function testing and chest CT scans for A(H7N9) patients during follow-up are presented in Table 2. Estimates of the cumulative rates of pulmonary dysfunction and chest CT scan abnormalities for A(H7N9) patients are shown in Fig. 2, Table S2-S3 (Supplementary materials). The cumulative rate of pulmonary dysfunction was 38·5% at 621 days (classified as “18-month follow-up visit” group) and 78·2% for chest CT scan abnormalities at 606 days (classified as “18-month follow-up visit” group) until the last follow-up.
